query.result:
1 Neither the going made him go, nor the going made him slower 2 but reasoning they went fast, 3 like a ship driven by a good wind;
4 and the shades, that seemed dead things, 5 through the pits of the eyes drew 6 admiration from me, aware of my living.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
7 E io, continüando al mio sermone, 8 dissi: «Ella sen va sù forse più tarda 9 che non farebbe, per altrui cagione.
query.result:
7 And I, continuing my speech, 8 said: "Perhaps she goes up more slowly 9 than she would, for someone else's sake.
(literal translation of line 9: "for another's reason")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, dov’ è Piccarda; 11 dimmi s’io veggio da notar persona 12 tra questa gente che sì mi riguarda».
query.result:
10 But tell me, if you know, where Piccarda is; 11 tell me if I see anyone worthy of note 12 among these people who are looking at me so intently.
(literal translation of line 12: "among these people who are looking at me so")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 «La mia sorella, che tra bella e buona 14 non so qual fosse più, trïunfa lieta 15 ne l’alto Olimpo già di sua corona».
query.result:
13 "My sister, who between beautiful and good 14 I do not know which was more, already triumphs joyfully 15 in high Olympus with her crown".
(literal translation of line 14: "I do not know which was more")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 Sì disse prima; e poi: «Qui non si vieta 17 di nominar ciascun, da ch’è sì munta 18 nostra sembianza via per la dïeta.
query.result:
16 Thus she said first; and then: "Here it is not forbidden 17 to name each one, since our appearance 18 is so consumed away by the diet.
(literal translation of line 18: "is so consumed away by the diet")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Questi», e mostrò col dito, «è Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; e quella faccia 21 di là da lui più che l’altre trapunta
22 ebbe la Santa Chiesa in le sue braccia: 23 dal Torso fu, e purga per digiuno 24 l’anguille di Bolsena e la vernaccia».
query.result:
19 "This one", and she pointed with her finger, "is Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; and that face 21 beyond him, more adorned than the others,
22 the Holy Church held in its arms: 23 he was from Torso, and he purges through fasting 24 the eels of Bolsena and the vernaccia".
(literal translation of line 24: "the eels of Bolsena and the vernaccia")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Molti altri mi nomò ad uno ad uno; 26 e del nomar parean tutti contenti, 27 sì ch’io però non vidi un atto bruno.
query.result:
25 She named many others to me, one by one; 26 and they all seemed content to be named, 27 so that I did not see a single frown.
(literal translation of line 27: "so that I did not see a single dark act")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 Vidi per fame a vòto usar li denti 29 Ubaldin da la Pila e Bonifazio 30 che pasturò col rocco molte genti.
query.result:
28 I saw Ubaldin dalla Pila and Bonifazio, 29 who shepherded many people with his crosier, 30 using their teeth to eat in vain because of hunger.
(literal translation of line 29: "who shepherded many people with his distaff")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
31 Vidi messer Marchese, ch’ebbe spazio 32 già di bere a Forlì con men secchezza, 33 e sì fu tal, che non si sentì sazio.
query.result:
31 I saw Messer Marchese, who once had the opportunity 32 to drink in Forlì with less dryness, 33 and yet he was such that he did not feel satisfied.
(literal translation of line 32: "to drink in Forlì with less dryness")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
34 Ma come fa chi guarda e poi s’apprezza 35 più d’un che d’altro, fei a quel da Lucca, 36 che più parea di me aver contezza.
query.result:
34 But as one does who looks and then values 35 one more than another, I did to the one from Lucca, 36 who seemed to be more acquainted with me.
(literal translation of line 35: "one more than another")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 El mormorava; e non so che «Gentucca» 38 sentiv’ io là, ov’ el sentia la piaga 39 de la giustizia che sì li pilucca.
query.result:
37 He was murmuring; and I heard something like "Gentucca" 38 there, where he felt the wound 39 of the justice that plucks at them so.
(literal translation of line 39: "of the justice that plucks at them so")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
40 «O anima», diss’ io, «che par sì vaga 41 di parlar meco, fa sì ch’io t’intenda, 42 e te e me col tuo parlare appaga».
query.result:
40 "O soul," I said, "who seem so eager 41 to speak with me, make me understand you, 42 and satisfy both you and me with your speech."
(literal translation of line 41: "make me understand you")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 «Femmina è nata, e non porta ancor benda», 44 cominciò el, «che ti farà piacere 45 la mia città, come ch’om la riprenda.
query.result:
43 "A woman is born, and does not yet wear a headband," 44 he began, "who will make you love 45 my city, even though people criticize it.
(literal translation of line 43: "A woman is born, and does not yet wear a veil")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
46 Tu te n’andrai con questo antivedere: 47 se nel mio mormorar prendesti errore, 48 dichiareranti ancor le cose vere.
query.result:
46 You will go with this foresight: 47 if you misunderstood my murmuring, 48 the true things will still be explained to you.
(literal translation of line 48: "the true things will still be declared to you")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 Ma dì s’i’ veggio qui colui che fore 50 trasse le nove rime, cominciando 51 ‘Donne ch’avete intelletto d’amore’».
query.result:
49 But tell me if I see here the one who, in the world, 50 brought forth the new rhymes, beginning 51 "Ladies who have intelligence of love".
(literal translation of line 51: "Ladies who have understanding of love")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 E io a lui: «I’ mi son un che, quando 53 Amor mi spira, noto, e a quel modo 54 ch’e’ ditta dentro vo significando».
query.result:
52 And I to him: "I am one who, when 53 Love inspires me, takes note, and in the way 54 that it is dictated within, I go on signifying".
(literal translation of line 54: "and in the way that it is said within, I go on signifying")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
55 «O frate, issa vegg’ io», diss’ elli, «il nodo 56 che ’l Notaro e Guittone e me ritenne 57 di qua dal dolce stil novo ch’i’ odo!
58 Io veggio ben come le vostre penne 59 di retro al dittator sen vanno strette, 60 che de le nostre certo non avvenne;
61 e qual più a gradire oltre si mette, 62 non vede più da l’uno a l’altro stilo»; 63 e, quasi contentato, si tacette.
query.result:
55 "O brother, now I see," he said, "the knot 56 that held back the Notary, Guittone, and me 57 from the sweet new style that I hear!
58 I see well how your pens 59 follow closely behind the dictator, 60 which certainly did not happen with ours;
61 and whoever sets out to be more pleasing beyond that 62 no longer sees the difference from one style to the other"; 63 and, almost satisfied, he fell silent.
(literal translation of line 59: "follow closely behind the one who dictates")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Come li augei che vernan lungo ’l Nilo, 65 alcuna volta in aere fanno schiera, 66 poi volan più a fretta e vanno in filo,
67 così tutta la gente che lì era, 68 volgendo ’l viso, raffrettò suo passo, 69 e per magrezza e per voler leggera.
query.result:
64 Like the birds that winter along the Nile, 65 sometimes form a flock in the air, 66 then fly faster and go in a line,
67 so all the people who were there, 68 turning their faces, quickened their pace, 69 and because of their thinness and their desire to be light.
(literal translation of line 69: "and because of their thinness and because of wanting to be light")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 E come l’uom che di trottare è lasso, 71 lascia andar li compagni, e sì passeggia 72 fin che si sfoghi l’affollar del casso,
73 sì lasciò trapassar la santa greggia 74 Forese, e dietro meco sen veniva, 75 dicendo: «Quando fia ch’io ti riveggia?».
query.result:
70 And like the man who is tired of trotting, 71 lets his companions go on, and walks slowly 72 until the crowding of his chest eases,
73 so Forese let the holy flock 74 pass by, and came behind me, 75 saying: "When will it be that I see you again?".
(literal translation of line 72: "until the crowding of his chest eases")

query.result:
82 "Now go," he said; "for the one who is most to blame for this, 83 I see dragged by the tail of a beast 84 toward the valley where one is never absolved.

Please translate literally into English.
88 Non hanno molto a volger quelle ruote», 89 e drizzò li occhi al ciel, «che ti fia chiaro 90 ciò che ’l mio dir più dichiarar non puote.
query.result:

Please translate literally into English.

query.result:

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
94 Qual esce alcuna volta di gualoppo 95 lo cavalier di schiera che cavalchi, 96 e va per farsi onor del primo intoppo,
97 tal si partì da noi con maggior valchi; 98 e io rimasi in via con esso i due 99 che fuor del mondo sì gran marescalchi.
query.result:

(literal translation of line 98: "and I remained on the way with them")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
100 E quando innanzi a noi intrato fue, 101 che li occhi miei si fero a lui seguaci, 102 come la mente a le parole sue,
103 parvermi i rami gravidi e vivaci 104 d’un altro pomo, e non molto lontani 105 per esser pur allora vòlto in laci.
query.result:

103 the branches appeared to me heavy and lively 104 with another fruit, and not very far away, 105 because it had just then turned into snares.
(literal translation of line 105: "because it had just then turned into nooses")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
106 Vidi gente sott’ esso alzar le mani 107 e gridar non so che verso le fronde, 108 quasi bramosi fantolini e vani
109 che pregano, e ’l pregato non risponde, 110 ma, per fare esser ben la voglia acuta, 111 tien alto lor disio e nol nasconde.
query.result:
106 I saw people beneath it raise their hands 107 and cry out something toward the leaves, 108 like greedy and vain little children
109 who pray, and the one prayed to does not answer, 110 but, to make their desire truly sharp, 111 keeps their longing high and does not hide it.
(literal translation of line 110: "but, to make their desire be truly sharp")

Please translate literally into English.
112 Poi si partì sì come ricreduta; 113 e noi venimmo al grande arbore adesso, 114 che tanti prieghi e lagrime rifiuta.
query.result:

(literal translation of line 113: "and we came to the great tree now")

115 «Trapassate oltre sanza farvi presso: 116 legno è più sù che fu morso da Eva, 117 e questa pianta si levò da esso».
query.result:

query.result:

query.result:
127 Thus, close to one of the two borders, 128 we passed, hearing sins of gluttony 129 followed by wretched gains.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
130 Poi, rallargati per la strada sola, 131 ben mille passi e più ci portar oltre, 132 contemplando ciascun sanza parola.
query.result:
130 Then, spreading out on the solitary road, 131 a good thousand paces and more carried us beyond, 132 each one contemplating in silence.
(literal translation of line 132: "each one contemplating without a word")

query.prompt:

133 «Che andate pensando sì voi sol tre?». 134 sùbita voce disse; ond’ io mi scossi 135 come fan bestie spaventate e poltre.
query.result:
133 "What are the three of you thinking about so intently?". 134 A sudden voice said; whereupon I shook 135 like frightened and lazy animals do.
(literal translation of line 135: "like frightened and lazy animals do")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
136 Drizzai la testa per veder chi fossi; 137 e già mai non si videro in fornace 138 vetri o metalli sì lucenti e rossi,
139 com’ io vidi un che dicea: «S’a voi piace 140 montare in sù, qui si convien dar volta; 141 quinci si va chi vuole andar per pace».
query.result:
136 I raised my head to see who it was; 137 and never were glass or metals seen in a furnace 138 so bright and red,
139 as I saw one who said: "If it pleases you 140 to go up, here you must turn; 141 this is the way for those who want to go in peace".
(literal translation of line 141: "this is the way for those who want to go for peace")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
142 L’aspetto suo m’avea la vista tolta; 143 per ch’io mi volsi dietro a’ miei dottori, 144 com’ om che va secondo ch’elli ascolta.
query.result:
142 His appearance had taken away my sight; 143 so I turned back to my teachers, 144 like one who goes as he hears.
(literal translation of line 144: "like one who goes as he listens")

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
151 E senti’ dir: «Beati cui alluma 152 tanto di grazia, che l’amor del gusto 153 nel petto lor troppo disir non fuma,
154 esurïendo sempre quanto è giusto!».
query.result:
151 And I heard a voice say: "Blessed are those whom 152 so much grace illumines, that the love of taste 153 does not smoke with too much desire in their breast,
154 hungering always for as much as is right!".
(literal translation of line 154: "hungering always for as much as is just")
